Action Taken: State of disaster declared.
Waiver issued to allow restaurants and bars allowed to deliver alcohol along with food purchases.
Driver license expiration date extended and Driver License offices closed.
De facto stay-at-home order issued.
Temporary prohibition of dining and bars/restaurants ordered, along with the closure of gyms.
Social gatherings involving more than 10 people prohibited.
Suspension of elective or non-essential medical procedures.
14-day quarantines mandated from travelers arriving from pandemic hot-spots in the U.S.
Social distancing protocols issued.
All non-essential businesses forced to close for 30 days.
Certain pharmacy, and health care worker regulations waived to increase workforce capabilities. Telehealth options expanded.
State parks and historical sites closed.
State parks and historical sites reopened.
Retail stores allowed to deliver goods to customers.
De facto stay-at-home order expired.
Start of Phase I: Retail establishments, restaurants, movie theaters, shopping malls, libraries and museums permitted to operate at 25% occupancy.
Hair salons and pools authorized to reopen.
Start of Phase II: Reopening of different types of businesses. Most businesses allowed to operate at 25% occupancy. Restaurant occupancy limit increased to 50%.
Start of Phase III: All businesses able to operate at up to 50% capacity. Some businesses able to operate at 100%. No capacity limits on most outdoor areas.
Restaurant occupancy limit increased to 75%.
Bars ordered to shut down and restaurant capacity limits reduced to 50%. Outdoor gatherings of more than 100 people banned unless government approval received.
No gatherings of more than 10 people unless local government approval received.
Masks mandated in enclosed public spaces in all counties with at least 20 confirmed cases.
